tz_prompt: ğŸŒ What timezone are you in?
tz_help: This is important so scheduled tasks (reminders, crons) run at the correct time.
step_provider_title: ğŸŒ Step 1 of 4 â€” Choose your AI provider
step_provider_help:
A provider is the service that powers your bot's intelligence.
If you're not sure which one to pick, we recommend OpenRouter ğŸŒ
It's the easiest: one key gives you access to many models.
step_model_title: ğŸŒ Now choose an AI model
step_model_help:
The model is your bot's "brain". Smarter models cost more
but give better answers. If you're not sure, pick the recommended one.
step_model_manual: ğŸ”¤ Type a model name manually
step_key_title: ğŸŒ Last provider step â€” your API key
step_key_help:
The API key is like your password to use the service.
Get one here: {url}
step_channel_title: ğŸŒ Step 2 of 4 â€” Where do you want to use your bot?
step_channel_help:
Choose the app where your bot will send and receive messages.
You can add more later with: banabot config
step_finish_title: ğŸŒ Step 3 of 4 â€” Almost done!
step_finish_help: You have the essentials configured. Want to tweak anything else?
step_finish_standard_desc: All set, your bot is configured with sensible defaults.
step_finish_custom_desc: Adjust temperature, tokens, gateway, tools, more channels...

ğŸŒ Configuration saved! Your bot is ready.

advanced_providers: ğŸ”‘ Providers (add or modify AI providers)

field_list_help: Separate values with commas. Leave empty to allow all.
field_secret_keep: Press Enter to keep current value
provider_openrouter: ğŸŒ OpenRouter (recommended â€” access to many models)
telegram_title: ğŸ“± Telegram â€” Let's create your bot step by step ğŸŒ
telegram_guide:
ğŸ“‹ How to create a Telegram bot:

  1. Open Telegram on your phone or computer
  2. Search for @BotFather in the Telegram search bar
  3. Tap on it and press "Start" (or type /start)
  4. Type /newbot
  5. BotFather will ask for a name for your bot
     (example: "My AI Assistant")
  6. Then it will ask for a username ending in
     "bot" (example: "my_ai_assistant_bot")
  7. Done! BotFather will give you a token that looks
     like: 123456789:ABCdefGHI-jklMNOpqrSTU
  8. Copy that token and paste it below â¬‡ï¸
telegram_restrict_question:
ğŸ”’ Do you want to restrict who can talk to your bot?
   (If you say no, anyone who finds your bot can use it)
telegram_success: âœ“ Telegram activated! Your bot can now receive messages ğŸŒ
discord_title: ğŸ® Discord â€” Connect your bot to Discord ğŸŒ
discord_guide:
ğŸ“‹ How to create a Discord bot:

  1. Go to https://discord.com/developers/applications
  2. Click "New Application" and give it a name
  3. Go to the "Bot" section in the left menu
  4. Click "Add Bot"
  5. In the Bot section, enable "MESSAGE CONTENT INTENT"
  6. Copy the bot token and paste it below â¬‡ï¸
whatsapp_title: ğŸ“² WhatsApp â€” Connect your bot to WhatsApp ğŸŒ
whatsapp_guide:
ğŸ“‹ WhatsApp uses a bridge to connect.
You need to have the WhatsApp bridge running.
More info: https://github.com/HKUDS/nanobot#whatsapp
whatsapp_token_prompt: Bridge token (optional, press Enter to skip)
email_title: ğŸ“§ Email â€” Connect your bot to email ğŸŒ
email_guide:
ğŸ“‹ You'll need your mail server details (IMAP and SMTP).
If you use Gmail, enable "App Passwords" in your account.
slack_title: ğŸ’¼ Slack â€” Connect your bot to Slack ğŸŒ
slack_guide:
ğŸ“‹ How to create a Slack bot:

  1. Go to https://api.slack.com/apps
  2. Create a new app "From scratch"
  3. Go to "Socket Mode" and enable it (copy the App Token: xapp-...)
  4. Go to "OAuth & Permissions" and add the required scopes
  5. Install the app to your workspace and copy the Bot Token (xoxb-...)
agent_model_help: The model your bot uses to think. Example: anthropic/claude-sonnet-4-5
agent_temperature_help: How creative the bot is (0.0 = precise, 1.0 = creative)
agent_max_iterations_help: How many times the bot can use tools in one response
agent_memory_window_help: How many messages the bot remembers in a conversation
